description:
SVL12000 (ALC PRESS INC.) looked up in the Oxford Dictionary of English (en.oxforddictionaries.com)

Ver.180210-0022 [Brought to you by h​onya#1726]

deck.question:

3. In, to, or for each; per (used when expressing rates or ratios).

Lv.01/12: [冠] 一つの

deck.question:

deck.question:

3. [preposition] Used to express location in a particular place.

‘he was drawing her down into an emotional whirlpool’

deck.question:
1. A long projecting hair or bristle growing from the face or snout of many mammals.
2. (a –) «informal» A very small amount.
3. A single crystal of a material in the form of a filament with no dislocations.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] ほおひげ
‘Every once in a while, particularly when I take out clothes that I haven't worn since our move, I find a cat whisker or a dog hair.’

deck.question:
1. [mass noun] A solution of lime and water or of whiting, size, and water, used for painting walls white.
 1. [in singular] A deliberate attempt to conceal unpleasant or incriminating facts about a person or organization in order to protect their reputation.
2. «informal» A victory by the same side in every game of a series.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] しっくい
‘the opposition called the report ‘a whitewash’’

deck.question: Pliable twigs, typically of willow, plaited or woven to make items such as furniture and baskets.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 枝編み細工
‘a wicker chair’

deck.question: One's customary behaviour.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 習慣
‘Constance, as was her wont, had paid her little attention’

deck.question: A key for tuning a harp or piano.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] ねじり
‘With respect to the harp, he produces the sharps, flats, quarter-notes, or any intermediate variation deviating from the natural notes, by causing the wrest-pins, that if, the pins by which the strings are extended and tuned, to move partly round centres and thereby increase or decrease the tension of the strings more or less, as may be required to answer the desired change of the notes.’

deck.question: A wriggling movement.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 身をくねらせること
‘she gave an impatient little wriggle’

deck.question:
1. Make twisting, squirming movements or contortions of the body.
 1. (– in/with/at) Respond with great emotional or physical discomfort to (an intense or unpleasant feeling or thought)
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [動] もだえ苦しむ
‘he writhed in agony on the ground’

deck.question: Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 外国人恐怖症
‘the resurgence of racism and xenophobia’

deck.question:
1. The time at which something is most powerful or successful.
2. ‹Astronomy› The point in the sky or celestial sphere directly above an observer.
 1. The highest point reached by a given celestial object.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 頂点、絶頂
‘in 1977, punk was at its zenith’

deck.question:
1. Great enthusiasm and energy.
 1. A quality of excitement and piquancy.
2. The outer coloured part of the peel of citrus fruit, used as flavouring.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 熱意
‘they campaigned with zest and intelligence’

deck.question:
1. ‹Astrology› A belt of the heavens within about 8° either side of the ecliptic, including all apparent positions of the sun, moon, and most familiar planets.
 1. A representation of the signs of the zodiac or of a similar astrological system.
2. «trademark» An inflatable dinghy powered by an outboard motor.
deck.comment:
Lv.12/12: [名] 十二宮図
‘Venus returns to the same portion of the zodiac after ten solar conjunctions, over a period of exactly 8 years.’
